properties.query:
//Author: Steven Wan
// Description: This analytics looks for a pattern of multiple failed logon events from the same remote IP address, within a short time frame, that is then followed by a successful logon event. Such a pattern suggests that an attacker tried brute force methods that eventually succeeded. It is possible that this analytic will produce false positives for a legitimate user forgetting a password, but they should be locked out of a single account before this anlaytic fires off.
// False Positives: Can be triggered by mass scanning. Currently known nessus usernames have been allow listed but this could fail if the account name srtucture changes
let scanning = dynamic([@"nessus_adm", @"nessus_mbr", @"nessus", @"svc-forescout.wks", @"sccm-clientpush.wks", @"acas"]);
DeviceLogonEvents
| where isnotempty(RemoteIP)
    and AccountName !endswith "$" and AccountName !endswith "wks"
    and not (AccountName has_any (scanning)) // nessus scanning accounts
//  and RemoteIPType == "Public" //Disabled to ensure both private and public are caught
| extend Account=strcat("AccountDomain: ", AccountDomain, " AccountName: ", AccountName)
| summarize
    Successful=countif(ActionType == "LogonSuccess"),
    Failed = countif(ActionType == "LogonFailed"),
    FailedAccountsCount = dcountif(Account, ActionType == "LogonFailed"),
    SuccessfulAccountsCount = dcountif(Account, ActionType == "LogonSuccess"),
    FailedAccounts = make_set_if(Account, ActionType == "LogonFailed"),
    SuccessfulAccounts = make_set_if(Account, ActionType == "LogonSuccess")
    by DeviceName, RemoteIP, RemoteIPType
| where Failed > 8
    and Successful > 0
    and FailedAccountsCount > 2
    and SuccessfulAccountsCount == 1
